column2: You live in a changing world. The world outside the Celtic West sees you as a heathen barbarian. Rome and England seek to extend their unfluence over your land. You are faced with a difficult choice: will you abandon tradition to reform the church, or will you stand definatly against the winds of change?
The Church is fundamentally out of touch with Rome and the wider Catholic world. I must work towards reform
Our traditional ways are best. The influence of Rome should be avoided
You have been chosen as High King of Ireland. However the throne is not secure. The lesser Kings of Ireland may reject you and try to take the title for themselves
I am the true High King!
The High King is dead. His heir sits the thone, but his legitimacy is derived from the will of the lesser Kings. Will you ackowledge the new king, or do you have your own ambitions for the thone?
The rightful king sits the throne
All the kings of Ireland have bowed to you. You are the true High King
In Medieval Wales and Ireland only individual power is respected. The lords that pledged alliegence to the former King may not do the same for you
Your King is dead. His heir now sits the throne, but you are not obliged to bend the knee to him. Will you remain loyal?
I am loyal to the King
I will bow to no King
The old king's vassals have made their choices. The realm is stable
You no longer command the respect that a King of Wales should. You are stripped of your title
No foreigner will ever be accepted as High King. You are stripped of your title
You are no longer worthy of being called "King" or "Prince"
You have disputed the title of High King of Ireland. It is time to fight for your throne
You have lost the High Kingship to one more worthy of the name

Your tireless efforts to reform the church both in reality and in the eyes of the Catholic world have been a great success. You can now proudly state that you are a Catholic ruler. History will remember your piety

You have been studying the culture of feudal Europe, and have found Scotland lacking in comparison. It is no surprise that we are considered a backwater when our culture and society have clinged to backwards traditional ways. It is time to put aside tradition and create a unified, feudal Scotland
I will create a new Scotland
The vision of a new Scotland is spreading to the masses as they adapt to urban and feudal life
It is time that my court understood my vision for Scotland
It is time that my vassals understood my vision for Scotland
My liege has convinced me that Scotland is changing  and that I must change with it
The previous ruler supported the High King, but perhaps I should not
The Cistercian Monks have been founded
Patrongage is handled through the intrigue tab
The White Monks in a province have brought about local reform
The White Monks in a province have brought about cultural unity
The White Monks in a province have brought about cultural unity
You are David I, King of Scotland. The game will begin now
You are the High King of Ireland. The game will begin now
Having decided to generously patronise a Cistercian abbey, you must now choose which abbey will receive the new community
The activity and presence of the White Monks in your province have adequately brought it into line with Catholicism
The activity and presence of the White Monks in your province have imposed religious and economic domination upon the local populace. It is now of your culture
The native Welsh barbarians have risen up against your rule in great numbers
The native Irish barbarians have risen up against your rule in great numbers.
You realize, of course, that this means...
A new Order of monks from Tiron have petitioned you for patronage. The influence of reformed monastic orders could help you reform Scotland
The Tironensians in this province have comprehensively reformed the church. It can now proudly be called a Catholic region
The Tironensians in this province have helped to spread your culture
The Tironensians in this province have helped to spread your culture
The Tironensians in this province have comprehensively reformed the church. It can now proudly be called a Catholic region
The Tironensians in this province have helped to spread your culture
Decide whether to adapt to a changing world or defiantly hold on to your cultural traditions
The White Monks can dramatically increase the rate of religious and cultural conversion as well as increase commerce on church land
Extend the reach of the White Monks to a new Abbey
The year is 1124 and David I has been crowned King of Scotland

column3: Se convertir à la religion du suzerain
column6: Convertir a la religión del señor

column2: By taking this decision, I will fully commit to the cause of church reform. My vassals may not share my vision however
column3: Nul doute que mon suzerain apprécierait que je partage sa foi...
column4: Ich bin sicher, dass mein Lehnsherr erfreut wäre, wenn wir denselben Glauben hätten ...
column6: Seguro que a mi señor le complacerá que tengamos la misma fe...

column2: Your status as an overlord is recognized by your vassals
You are dedicated to reforming your religiously backward country
You are dedicated to preserving the traditions of the Celtic church and resisting integration with the Catholic world
The petty kings of Ireland have acknowledged you as High King
A reformed monk of the Cistercian Order, also called the White Monks
A reformed monk of the Tironensian Order, also called the Grey Monks
